page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: The area under study is located 3 miles from Stroud, 10 miles from Cirencester and 5 miles from Tetbury. The bedrock is Greater Oolite with Forest Marble, being on the dip slope of the Cotswolds. The only major physical feature is a periglacial dry valley running N-S, just north of Cherington. The major land use is agriculture with a small portion of M.O.D.land at Aston Down. There are the two nucleated settlements of Cherington and Avening, plus scattered farms and associated buildings. Amenities within the area are limited and the car is the major mode of transport. Many residents were born within the County, local dialect is used in remoter areas and the ancient burial mounds have given rise to a wealth of folklore.
